conclusion: Result we need: the magnetic flux linked with the coil changes only over the half–area that is inside the field.

premise: The square has total area A = a²
conclusion: Area effectively exposed to the field Ainside = ½ A = a² / 2
Magnetic induction increases uniformly from B to 2 B in time Δt

premise: Magnetic induction increases uniformly from B to 2 B
Area effectively exposed to the field Ainside = a² / 2 and ΔB = B
conclusion: Change of flux through one turn ΔΦ₁ = Ainside · ΔB = (a² / 2) · B

premise: Change of flux through one turn ΔΦ₁ = (a² / 2) · B and coil has n turns
conclusion: Total change of flux ΔΦ = n · ΔΦ₁ = n · B · a² / 2
By Faraday’s law the (magnitude of the) induced e.m.f. is ε = |ΔΦ| / Δt

premise: Total change of flux ΔΦ = n · B · a² / 2 and Faraday’s law ε = |ΔΦ| / Δt
